com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Interface TocListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
TocAdapter
public interface TocListener
extends EventListener

Implements an interface for objects wishing to be notified about TocEvents.

See Also:
TocEvent

Method Summary
 void check(TocEvent e)
          Invoked whenever a Layer's CheckBox is either checked or un-checked.
 void click(TocEvent e)
          Invoked whenever a mouse click occurs within a Legend.
 void focus(TocEvent e)
          Invoked whenever a focus event occurs within a LegendPanel.
 void key(TocEvent e)
          Invoked whenever a key event occurs within a LegendPanel.
 void swatch(TocEvent e)
          Invoked whenever a mouse click occurs within a swatch.
 

Method Detail

check

public void check(TocEvent e)
Invoked whenever a Layer's CheckBox is either checked or un-checked. Note that the Toc will manage the Visible property of the Layer, but will not manage the appearance of the Map - you have to refresh the Map Display. You can find the current visibility of the Layer by examining its Visible property.

Parameters:
e - the TocEvent

click

public void click(TocEvent e)
Invoked whenever a mouse click occurs within a Legend. You can get the complete MouseEvent from the TocEvent, which will give the details such as, which mouse button was clicked, and how many clicks occured. You can also get the source Legend from the TocEvent.

If AutoSelecting is switched "on" for the Toc, then you can find out what the new state of the Legend's Selected property using its isSelected method.

See Also:
Toc.setAutoSelecting(boolean)

swatch

public void swatch(TocEvent e)
Invoked whenever a mouse click occurs within a swatch. You can get the complete MouseEvent from the TocEvent, which gives details such as which mouse button was clicked, and how many clicks occured. You can also get the source Symbol and the Layer from the TocEvent.

key

public void key(TocEvent e)
Invoked whenever a key event occurs within a LegendPanel. You can get the complete KeyEvent from the TocEvent, which will give the details such as which key is presssed and the modifier associtated with the key. You can also get the source Legend from the TocEvent.

focus

public void focus(TocEvent e)
Invoked whenever a focus event occurs within a LegendPanel. You can get FOCUS GAINED, FOCUS LOST ids from the TocEvent to distiguish between focusGained and focusLost events. You can also get the source Legend from the TocEvent.
